summary: This document contains internal communications regarding the AML compliance review of alerts related to Jeffrey Epstein. It discusses the clearance of alerts that were deemed false positives and the approval process for onboarding Epstein as a client. The correspondence highlights the reputational concerns associated with Epstein and the decision-making process within the compliance team.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the subject of the AML compliance review, with alerts being cleared for him to onboard as a client despite negative reputation information.

persons.name: Chip Packard
persons.context: Chip Packard provided email approval supporting the decision to onboard Jeffrey Epstein, indicating no reputational risk.

persons.name: Andrew J. Kisz
persons.context: Andrew J. Kisz is involved in the AML compliance review and communicates the clearance of alerts related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Amanda Kirby
persons.context: Amanda Kirby is coordinating the clearance process for Jeffrey Epstein's client onboarding and is involved in the communication regarding the alerts.

persons.name: Andrea Klingenberg
persons.context: Andrea Klingenberg is included in the correspondence regarding the clearance of alerts for Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Chip Packard, as senior management, supports the decision to onboard Jeffrey Epstein as a client.
Andrew J. Kisz is responsible for the AML compliance review related to Jeffrey Epstein's client onboarding.
Amanda Kirby is managing the onboarding process for Jeffrey Epstein as a client.

events.title: RDC and PCR Alerts Review
events.description: AML Compliance reviewed alerts related to Jeffrey Epstein, determining some were false positives.

events.title: Client Onboarding Approval Request
events.description: Amanda Kirby follows up on the clearance approval for onboarding Jeffrey Epstein as a client.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a prospective client with alerts related to negative reputation information.
AML Compliance cleared alerts for Jeffrey Epstein based on approval from Chip Packard and senior management.
There are two PCR alerts concerning a different individual named Jeffrey S. Epstein, which were deemed false positives.
The accounts to be opened for Epstein will not be in his name but in the names of two companies he controls.
